meanings.definition: To attempt or make an effort
meanings.sent1: I will try to jump over the small hurdle.
meanings.sent2: She will try her best to finish the race.
meanings.sent3: Let's try to reach the top of the hill before sunset!
meanings.sent4: In life, we must try to overcome challenges like climbing a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The young bird will try to fly for the first time from the nest.

meanings.sent1: Scientists try different chemicals to see their reactions.
meanings.sent2: Students try mixing colors to create new shades.
meanings.sent3: Let's try combining peanut butter with pickles for a unique taste!
meanings.sent4: In the lab, researchers try to unlock the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The chef will try various spices to enhance the flavor of the dish.

meanings.sent1: Please try this delicious cake I baked.
meanings.sent2: They will try a small piece of the exotic fruit.
meanings.sent3: Let's try the new ice cream flavor before it melts!
meanings.sent4: At the food festival, visitors try different cuisines from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The food critic will try the signature dish of the restaurant for the review.

meanings.definition: To put to the test or subject to trial
meanings.sent1: The coach will try the new player in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent2: They will try the new software to check for bugs.
meanings.sent3: Let's try the durability of this new phone by dropping it gently.
meanings.sent4: In court, lawyers try to prove their case with evidence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will try the students' knowledge with a surprise quiz.
